text.value: The letter/number sequence representing the district (or region) and burn number
What year did the area you're assessing last burn?
Is the burn severity similar within a 30 m radius?
Stratum 1: Vegetation under 0.5 m tall (include sedges)
Dominant vegetation below 0.5 m tall before burn
Record first few letters of species common name or Scientific name (genus/species). i.e., for Jarrah use 'Jar' or 'Eucmar'
How much area did vegetation under 0.5 m cover before the burn? First ask, was it more than half (50%)? Then ask if it was more than 25% or more than 75%.
Approximate the percentage of area not burned. A large patch is at least 2 m by 2 m. A small patch is smaller than 2 m by 2 m.
Approximate the percentage of area that has bare ground. Do not include areas w/moss or cryptograms as 'bare.'
Approximate the percentage of area that has green growth on the ground. Include seedlings and regrowth from shrubs and trees.
When looking down at an unburnt shrub, how much ground is visible between the leaves?
Less than 25% of the ground is visible.
25-50% of the ground is visible, and the shrub is at least 1.5 m long or wide.
25-50% of the ground is visible, but the shrub is less than 1.5 m long or wide
Can see more ground than leaves or twigs, and the shrub is at least 1.5 m long or wide.
Can see more ground than leaves or twigs, and the shrub is smaller than 1.5 m long or wide.
Take a photo of the ground and plants less than 0.5 m tall.
Dominant vegetation in stratum before burn
Record first few letters of species common name or Scientific name (genus/species). i.e., for Jarrah use 'Jar' or 'Eucmar'
Average height of shrubs and heath [m]
How much area did the shrubs and heath above 0.5 m tall cover before the burn? First ask, was it more than half (50%)? Then ask if it was more than 25% or more than 75%.
How much of the crown is intact, either green or brown?

The number and size of thickets that still have brown or green leaves. A thicket is the same type of shrub clustered together so their crowns are almost or actually touching. A large patch is at least 2 m by 2 m. A small patch is smaller than 2 m by 2 m.
50% or more area has thickets w/leaves.
Thickets are bare or burnt away.
Density of bare shrubs at least 0.5 m tall
How many bare sticks w/no green or brown leaves are still standing?
None (all have brown or green leaves)
Moderate (sometimes brush against sticks when walking thru area)
Medium dense (often brush against sticks when walking thru area)
Dense (have to push sticks aside to walk thru area)
Sticks burnt away to below 1 m
How many grass trees still have skirts?
How high does fresh black char extend up the shrubs and heath in this stratum?
Approximate how much of the crown was scorched, including both brown and fallen leaves
Take 1-4 portrait-oriented photos that include the entire vegetation structure, if possible.
Dominant vegetation of trees and shrubs emerging over vegetation
Record first few letters of species common name or Scientific name (genus/species). i.e., for Jarrah use 'Jar' or 'Eucmar'
How much area did the emergent fuel cover before the burn? First ask, was it more than half (50%)? Then ask if it was more than 25% or more than 75%.
How much crown remains, whether green or brown?
How many trees have fallen after the burn?
What is the lowest level where most trees are resprouting?
How high does fresh black char extend up the trees?
Take a photo of the emergent/overstorey canopy.
